title: Temporarily disable admin authentication and admin permission checks

requirements.text: Disable the admin-route authentication gate so users can access the admin portal without logging in via Internet Identity (no redirect to `/admin/login` and no admin-status check) while this temporary mode is enabled.

quotes: remove authemtication for now from amdin

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to `/admin` in a fresh browser session (no Internet Identity login) renders the Admin portal layout and dashboard pages instead of redirecting to `/admin/login`.
Admin routes under `/admin/*` remain reachable without an identity present (e.g., `/admin/products`, `/admin/offers`, `/admin/customers`, `/admin/notifications`).
No UI state is blocked by AdminGuard loading/redirect states when identity is absent.

requirements.text: Update the admin login page behavior for the temporary no-auth mode so it does not prompt for Internet Identity login; instead it should provide a simple message that admin authentication is currently disabled and a button/link to enter the admin portal.

quotes: remove authemtication for now from amdin

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting `/admin/login` does not require Internet Identity login in the temporary no-auth mode.
The page displays clear English text indicating admin authentication is temporarily disabled and provides a working action to navigate to `/admin`.

requirements.text: Temporarily disable backend admin permission enforcement for all admin-only endpoints so that admin UI operations (orders dashboard, order status updates, products CRUD, offers CRUD, customers list/detail) work without an authenticated admin principal while this temporary mode is enabled.

quotes: remove authemtication for now from amdin

acceptanceCriteria: Calls to existing admin-only backend methods (e.g., `getAllOrders`, `updateOrderStatus`, `createProduct`, `updateProduct`, `deleteProduct`, `getAllOffers`, `createOffer`, `updateOffer`, `activateOffer`, `deactivateOffer`, `deleteOffer`, `getAllCustomers`, `getCustomer`) succeed for an unauthenticated/anonymous caller while the temporary no-auth mode is enabled.
Customer-facing endpoints (e.g., browsing products, placing orders) continue to function as before.
No data migration is required for this change (state remains compatible).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo` (no additional services).
Do not modify any frontend files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or the immutable hook/bootstrap paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Implementing a permanent admin authentication redesign or role-management UI.
Adding the previously-mentioned customer profile section / unique ID flow (not requested in the latest instruction to build).
Adding third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
